resources.string: Looks like you changed your QuickBooks plan. To start using it on this device, download the QuickBooks Accounting app.
Get the bundle for faster tax filing
Find everything in the app, right here.
The navigation menu moved down here for quicker access.
Add your contact info to invoices
Add info about your %s tax situation
Add info about the vehicle you drive for work
Get instructions for uploading a file with your bank transactions
This is the info that appears on your invoices (logo, contact info, and more).
Get relevant discounts, surveys, and promotional communications from Quickbooks Self-Employed.
Let your accountant access your data
Check your settings to avoid missed trips
Turn this on if you’re missing trips or make frequent stops at a slow speed, like a mailman or a curious snail
Enhances GPS tracking at your start/end locations, but consumes more battery power.
Forward your email receipts to us and we’ll attach them to matching expenses
Get set up to take payments online
They can help you manage your books and find the tax savings you deserve.
Invite them to sign in with their own email and password.
Your accountant can sign in to your QuickBooks Self-Employed account and do all the same tasks you do.
Note: You can remove accountant access at any time from this screen.
You’ve disconnected from your current accountant, so you’ll be flying solo for a while. You can’t invite a new accountant just yet. We’re working to get this fixed soon.
We’ll notify you when your accountant joins.
Please enter a valid email address
Switch to a computer to upload transactions
The easiest way to get transactions is to connect your bank. But if your bank isn’t supported or you want older transactions, you can upload them instead.
It’s OK to send me discounts, surveys, and promotions.
I want to receive this info
Keep your banks connected. Just give the word.
To keep your bank accounts connected, we need your permission.
Receipts in your inbox? Send them our way. We’ll match them to your expenses.

resources.string: One of your banks will stop syncing soon. Let’s fix it.
One of your banks stopped syncing. Let’s fix it.
Swipe self-employment income and\nspending to the left
Nice! Now we can unlock your deductions.\nTo edit the business category, just tap\nafter swiping.
Don’t include personal items.\nSwipe them right to dismiss.
Great job! You can find all reviewed\ntransactions in the Reviewed tab.
I already know how this works
Sort transactions automatically. Less swiping, more tax deductions!
Pending items are temporary and may change. Only posted transactions can be categorized.
To see receipts we matched to your reviewed transactions, go to Transactions > Reviewed.
Use for duplicates, reimbursements,\ncustomer refunds, returned purchases, etc.
Are you sure you want to delete this receipt?
Your device doesn’t support viewing this file type. Try viewing the file on our web application.
Add a new split line item
Vendor Name must not be empty
Are you sure you want to cancel and lose any changes?
Are you sure want to cancel and lose any changes along with the uploading in progress?
Are you sure you want to delete this transaction?
Please wait for the upload to complete before saving.
Something went wrong. Try refreshing the page.
If that doesn’t sound right, try changing the filters.
Add a bank to download transactions automatically or, add transactions manually with the Add (+) button.
We’re having trouble connecting to your bank.
Use this option for duplicates, reimbursements, customer refunds or returned purchases
Let’s prep you for tax time
Get everything shipshape by completing these tasks.
Add or review tangible, lasting items >$200 you purchased for your self-employed work.
Add any cash expenses or business purchases you made with a personal credit card.
Health insurance costs can be a big write-off
On your computer, visit selfemployed.intuit.com/login and look for the tax checklist. From there, complete the healthcare profile to see if you qualify for these deductions.
If you qualify, you’ll need to know how much you spent on healthcare. Be sure to sort expenses as either premiums or health savings account (HSA) contributions.
Great job reviewing your healthcare profile!
If you qualified for these deductions, sort healthcare expenses as either premiums or HSA contributions to get the largest write-off possible.
From a computer, check entertainment expenses
New tax laws don’t let you deduct entertainments for clients. Sign in to our website to check for these expenses.
Meals with clients are still 50% deductible. Go to selfemployed.intuit.com/login to check these expenses so your deduction is accurate.
Make sure to sort unreviewed trips to maximize your deductions.
Your Meals and Entertainment expenses look good to go
Double-checking these expenses means your deduction is as accurate as it can be.
Make sure to sort unreviewed expenses to maximize your deductions.
Your data is good to go! On a computer, go to
to send it off to your accountant or TurboTax.
Prefer to use your phone? Turn on notifications in our app and in device Settings to get a message when phone export is ready.
Review entertainment expenses on a computer
For an accurate deduction, you need to review your Meals and Entertainment expenses.
On a computer, go to selfemployed.intuit.com/login.
Afterward, view your tax summary from either phone or computer.
Here’s a summary of your self-employed tax info. We send the bulk of it over to TurboTax, but some amounts you’ll need to enter manually. Questions? We have answers.
You can make changes in TurboTax, but they don’t sync back to QuickBooks. You can only send the info once.
Remember to use your TurboTax sign-in
Use your TurboTax sign-in: %s. This is where we’ll send your info.

We show your tracked income, which can include sales tax, reimbursements and other fees the IRS doesn’t treat as income. This means the income you tracked here may not match the amount you report on your tax return.
Add a label to save address to favorite locations
Remove this name from all your trips?
You’ll see the full address instead.
Another favorite location has this name
Choose a different name for this location.
Another favorite location is too close by
The address is the same, or so close that it looks the same to your device’s GPS.
Your change applies to all trips with this address.
Which do you want to edit?
To simplify trip tracking, add the addresses you go to often and give them a name.
Unable to fetch favorite locations. Please try again later.
Unable to delete favorite location. Please try again later.
Unable to save favorite location. Please try again later.
Unable to update favorite location. Please try again later.
Confirm you want to mark these trips as Business - %1$s?
Confirm you want to mark these trips as Personal?
Tap and hold a trip to get into the bulk selection mode.

We automatically determine start and stop locations based upon your time in transit and the amount of time you spend at a location.
All of your transaction data for this account will be deleted. This action cannot be undone.
This stops syncing future transactions, but saves all existing transactions.
You can still view all existing transactions. If you’re not using this account anymore, you can delete it.
This resumes syncing future transactions, and saves all existing transactions.
Tap Add (+) to add a bank and get automatic downloads of your bank transactions.
Have other accounts at this bank?

We’re still fixing your connection. Thanks for your patience.
Your connection is working again. Update your transactions to make sure everything is current.
This field should not be empty
Your transactions are now ready to review.
We’re now downloading your transactions. This might take a few minutes.
Bank-level encryption keeps your data safe.

About the size of a small bedroom

Select the size of your home office:
First up: Let’s auto-track your expenses.
Track your income and expenses automatically.

Tame the tax beast. Stay ahead all year and avoid surprises.
Hungry for it? Sign in at selfemployed.intuit.com.

Your suggestion of %1$s has been successfully recorded
App notification about transaction, key dates, enhancements, and more, excluding mileage tracking

We noticed that you signed up using our website. Please head back to selfemployed.intuit.com on your computer to subscribe!
You need an Internet connection and a valid Google Play account in order to make a purchase.
Unable to verify your purchase. Please try again later.
No thanks, I’ll wait for full price
Turn it on to keep using automatic mileage tracking.
This trip will be removed from your history. Select a reason to confirm.
Automatic mileage tracking is off. Sign back in to QuickBooks to start tracking trips again.
Create rules to sort trips and find deductions automatically.
Add a rule to start automatically sorting transactions and make your life easier.

Sit back and enjoy the ride

If the name on a transaction is
When this is on, we only apply your rule to transactions with exactly the name that’s in the rule (no extra characters).
This doesn’t change any transactions you already sorted.
Invalid percentage. Total percentages cannot exceed 100.
Apply this rule only to future transactions or to all transactions (past and future)?\n\nNote: applying this rule to all transactions will recategorize any existing transactions that match this rule.
If you delete the rule, past transactions that fall under this rule will remain the same, but the rule will not be applied to any future transactions.
Shows details about your business and personal transactions, including description, amount, date, category, and more.
Shows details about your business and personal trips, including purpose, distance, deduction amount, and more.
Shows how much you made and spent so you can see how profitable you are. Also called a P&L or income statement.
Shows how much of your income is taxable. Includes the total amount of deductions in each Schedule C category.
Shows your spending by SA103F category, your income after allowable expenses (net profit), and tax amounts.
Summarizes your income and expenses, shows your net profit or loss, and lists tax amounts.
Shows your spending by category, your income after expenses (net income), and GST you collected and paid.
Shows your spending by category, your income after expenses (net income), and sales tax you collected and paid.
A more detailed version of the tax summary that lists the individual transactions in each category.
A more detailed version of the tax summary that lists the individual transactions in each category.
A more detailed version of the tax summary that lists the individual transactions in each category.
A more detailed version of the tax summary that lists the individual transactions in each Schedule C category.
Export copies of your receipts. We get them ready to download, then email you. (Heads up that you’ll need to switch to a computer.)

resources.string: Get paid for your work, no matter where you are.
Accept payments for free and know when they’re on the way.
Got a minute to let us know \nhow we’re doing?
Don’t forget to file and pay your taxes by %1$s.
Did you know you can send your info to TurboTax for faster tax filing?
We think you’re fascinating. We’d love to know a bit about your work.
Sorry to hear that. How can we improve?
Want to support us by leaving a review?
Accountants help you save more! Connect with your accountant.
Meet your new assistant. Artificially intelligent, genuinely helpful.
Receipts in your pocket? Wallet? Car? We can fix that.

We’re constantly working on improvements. Contact us to share what you think.

Sign in to QuickBooks Self-Employed on a tablet or desktop browser.

The checklist helps you organize everything you need for filing.

Hmmm, we can’t find a good industry fit. Try a different keyword?
Thanks a ton! This helps us make a better app for folks like you.

Your sales tax is set up
Now you can apply it to your transactions and invoices.

Do you need to lodge BAS? Review your tax summary report to get the numbers.
Not now, no problem. Turn on sales tax anytime in Settings > Your Work Info.
Pick a transaction and hit the toggle to include sales tax.
Where do you collect and pay sales tax?
Select a province to make sure you charge the correct sales tax. Currently, Quebec and QST aren’t supported.
How do you want to show sales tax on invoices?
GST is 10%. How do you want to show GST on invoices?
Charge sales tax? Add it to invoices, plus track how much you collect and owe.
We’ll stop putting sales tax calculations on your invoices and transactions. This won’t affect any invoices you sent or saved already, nor will it affect any transactions tracked.
Add it as a separate line (Exclusive)
Most people in your area choose this option

Needs to be set to high

Self-Employed needs your location info to track trips accurately. This info is used exclusively for mileage tracking to calculate deductions.
We’re working hard to wipe out mileage tracking issues. Thanks for sticking with us.

Forward receipts from your online purchases and we’ll enter the details for you.

Tap Continue and we’ll finish setting up receipt forwarding for you.
You\’re set up to forward receipts from:

Our fault, not yours. We need some time to straighten this out. Please wait a few hours, and then try reloading.
Receipt forwarding is taking a short break. Please try again later.
You\’ll keep your existing transactions, but the closed account will stop syncing with QuickBooks.
You’re all set. QuickBooks is bringing in transactions from your new account.

It looks like you\’ve closed one (or more) of your accounts
When one account closes, another one opens…

Keep your transactions coming in by giving consent to connect, even if you’re already connected. We’ll walk you through how

resources.string: Get back on track with the new, even better %1$s connection

Check your connection

Looks like we need to double-check your %1$s connection. We’ll take you to the bank site to sign in so we can get everything back on track.

Your new %1$s connection is on the way!

We want to make sure everything’s good and connected first, so you don’t miss a single transaction.

%1$s connection expires %2$s

UK Open Banking regulation requires you to update your connection every 90 days. Update now to keep transactions coming into QuickBooks.

%1$s connection expired

UK Open Banking regulation requires you to directly authorise your connection every 90 days. Reconnect now to keep transactions coming into QuickBooks.

resources.string: Our servers are taking a short break.
Grab yourself a little me time. We´ll be back soon.
How we track mileage to drive up your tax deductions
This lets us use your device location to track mileage automatically. You can disable access in the app and from your device settings.
Enabling physical activity enhances the accuracy of mileage tracking. You can disable tracking from your device settings.
To learn more about how we use your data, see our Privacy Statement.
There’s a smarter way to sort trips. Take it for a spin!
You’ve got new groups of trips ready to sort.
"Trips of a feather: Review them together"
"We grouped similar trips for speedier sorting."
"Try the smart new way to sort trips"
"Review a bunch of similar trips all at once."
Are these trips all alike? Sort them in one go. (Uncheck any trips you want to sort separately.)
Almost done! Review the rest of the group.
No groups to review right now.\nCheck back soon!

resources.string: How’s it going with QuickBooks Self-Employed?
We want to get better. Would you mind giving us some quick feedback?
Would you take a sec to rate us on Google Play?"
Track trips and find deductions automatically.
We’re ready to track your trips.
Use the filter above if you want to see trips from another year.
Never miss a mile. Save on taxes with every work trip.
Save on taxes while you drive for work.
Mileage tracking is all set up. Take a trip to see it here.
To auto-track miles, update your settings.
You can customize which ones you get.
Stay up to date on invoices
Stay up to date on transactions
Stay up to date on trips
When the due date is coming up
When you have transactions to review (once a day)
When you have receipts to review

If you’re part of a family plan, contact the plan owner to update your billing info.
We ran into a billing issue in the Google Play Store, where you subscribed. Update your info to avoid cancellation and loss of any discount.
Your QuickBooks Self-Employed subscription is on hold because of a billing issue. Please update your Apple billing info and come back in 24 hours.
We ran into a billing issue. Update your info to avoid cancellation and loss of any discount. Changes may take a few hours.
Thank you for updating your payment information
Want to pause your account for 3 months instead?
We’ll pause your account for 3 months. You can reactivate anytime during that period.
While paused, we’ll store your info safely and we won’t bill you.
After pausing, you’ll still have access to your account’s info until the end of your billing cycle.
The pause feature is not quite ready yet, but we’re working on it. Do you still want to cancel right now?
Look at everything you accomplished so far.
Unable to load your data. Please try again later.

Check out your shiny new dashboard
Now get a clearer snapshot of your finances and dive deeper to see monthly trends.
We’ll let you know about important invoice updates and approaching due dates.
This invoice has QuickBooks payments enabled. Marking it as unpaid will not trigger a refund. You will need to manually refund the customer.
You’ll need to add a customer and a product or service to preview your invoice.
This invoice has a negative total amount. Please update total to positive amount in order to save.
This invoice has an invalid total amount. Please update total to amount less than 100000000000 in order to save.
This invoice does not have a valid customer email address. Please update the customer email address in order to send invoice.
This Product or Service has an invalid total amount. Please update total to amount less than 100000000000 in order to save.
If so, we’ll auto-categorize your %1$d unreviewed %2$s transactions and all future ones.
We weren’t able to categorize those transactions because of a connection issue.
